CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Torture) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in ORG , LOC . He is serving a prison sentence in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in ORG on suspicion of organised murder and robbery . He was placed in a temporary detention facility at the police station ( ИВС при УВД – ORG ) in ORG . On DATE he was remanded in pre - trial custody .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , at TIME on DATE the applicant was checked out of the ORG in ORG ; he was handcuffed with his hands behind his back , blindfolded with a canvas bag pulled over his head , and put on the floor of a police minibus . Several police officers and CARDINAL other detainees were in the same vehicle . As soon as the vehicle drove off the policemen began punching and kicking the applicant to force him to confess to the murder and to make him sign some documents . They hit him on the body and head , twisted his fingers , pulled on the handcuffs and tightened them behind his back . This lasted for TIME , until they arrived at a place described by the applicant as “ somewhere in a forest ” . The applicant was taken out of the vehicle and the beatings resumed . The applicant was spread on the ground , strangled with a rope or a belt , then his shoes were taken off and the police officers hit him on the heels with a wooden baton . The applicant claimed that he passed out several times , but when he regained consciousness the beating resumed ; he was hit in the head and on the body , kicked on the groin , and strangled again . The applicant claimed that the ill - treatment in the forest lasted TIME . After that the policemen put the applicant back into the van and drove on . In the van they continued to beat and intimidate him . The applicant remained blindfolded the whole time . When they arrived at ORG of the ORG in ORG the bag was removed from his head and he was checked into the ORG ’s ORG . He was placed in cell no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . The applicant remained in the ORG in ORG until DATE . He allegedly requested to see a doctor , but this was refused . On DATE the applicant was brought back to ORG and released there .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant saw a doctor at ORG in ORG ; he reported the ill - treatment and complained of headaches , vertigo , pain in the chest and abdomen and injuries to his feet and wrists . He was diagnosed with a head injury , possible concussion , and bruises on the chest and on the left foot .

CARDINAL . On an unidentified date DATE the applicant requested the prosecutor ’s office of ORG to investigate the ill - treatment in criminal proceedings . On DATE the applicant was questioned by the police about the alleged ill - treatment . The case was then assigned to the assistant prosecutor who questioned the applicant on DATE . Both times the applicant spoke in detail about the episode of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the assistant prosecutor ordered a medical examination by forensic experts to identify the applicant ’s injuries , establish their origin and the time of their occurrence . On DATE he was examined by the forensic expert who then requested the applicant ’s medical file from ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the assistant prosecutor questioned the guard who was on duty at the ORG when the applicant was checked out . He submitted that on DATE the applicant was checked out at TIME by CARDINAL police officers from the special squadron . After the applicant had been signed out they picked up his belongings , handcuffed the applicant and pulled a canvas bag over his head . CARDINAL other detainees were checked out at the same time and were taken away in the same vehicle . As far as he could tell , nobody ill - treated the applicant before the group left the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the assistant prosecutor questioned CARDINAL detainees , GPE and ORG , who were transferred to ORG on DATE with the applicant , and on CARDINAL DATE he questioned CARDINAL of the convoy policemen . ORG both said that they did not see anything because they were blindfolded , and that they did not hear any violence during the transfer . The convoy officer submitted that he and other policemen had carried CARDINAL detainees in the minibus and that they had made no stops on the way and had not used any force during the transfer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was detained again , and remained in detention pending trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the chief medical officer of ORG replied to the enquiry from the prosecutor ’s office , stating that on DATE the applicant had been examined by a traumatologist and had been sent for an X - ray , after which he did not come back to the admissions office . He stated that the applicant had indicated that the injuries were caused on DATE and were the result of a domestic accident .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office refused to open a criminal investigation into the allegation of ill - treatment , on the grounds that they were unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE , having received the applicant ’s medical file from the hospital , the forensic expert drew a report stating , in so far as relevant , as follows :

On the right side of the abdomen , covering a total area of QUANTITY , barely visible , are healing multiple abrasions ... , an abrasion on the outside of the right wrist QUANTITY ... , on the same level below the elbow bone there is a healing abrasion QUANTITY ... On the inner left wrist there is an abrasion of QUANTITY ... , on the outside there is a stripe - like abrasion of QUANTITY . Reports pain during palpation of the right side of the chest at the level of the seventh and the eighth ribs , on the line between the front and armpit , also reports pain when inhaling sharply or coughing . According [ to the applicant ] , he has pain in the soft tissues of the left foot ; no injury [ can be seen ] there . Sought medical aid at the admissions office of ORG on DATE , [ was examined by ] traumatologist . Medical files requested .

On DATE , [ record made by ] traumatologist . Complains of pain in the right side of the chest , headaches , nausea and vertigo . Beaten up DATE . Objective finding : condition of medium gravity ... Abdomen soft , painful when palpated . Reports pain during palpation of the left side of the chest ... Diagnosis : bruise on the left side of the chest , bruise on the left foot . On DATE . Headaches , vertigo ... Diagnosis : closed craniocerebral injury , concussion , bruise on the chest . On CARDINAL DATE , [ record made by ] traumatologist . Complains of pain in the fingers . Diagnosis : bruise on the chest . No other records made . The X - ray of the right side of the chest made on DATE reveals no bone fractures . ... The X - ray of hands and wrists in straight projection reveals no bone fractures . The X - ray of heel bones in CARDINAL projections reveals no bone fractures . Treatment by traumatologist continues ... .

CARDINAL . On DATE a medical examination established that Mr PERSON had healing abrasions on the abdomen and the right and left wrist , caused by blunt hard object(s ) . The abrasions on the wrists could have been caused by objects like handcuffs . These injuries could have dated back to DATE prior to the examination .
CARDINAL . These injuries caused no damage to health .
CARDINAL . The clinically established diagnosis of concussion is not supported by objective clinical data , and therefore its gravity is not susceptible to evaluation . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant was not informed of the results of the forensic examination and was not provided with a copy of the report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received a letter informing him of the decision dispensing with a criminal investigation into the alleged ill - treatment . On DATE he lodged a complaint with the prosecutor of ORG contesting that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG provided the prosecutor ’s office with an extract from the applicant ’s medical file . It stated that on DATE the applicant complained of pains in the head and chest and was sent for X - ray screening . On DATE he was examined by a traumatologist . The chest and head X - ray did not reveal any pathology . He was diagnosed with bruises on the chest and left foot . On CARDINAL DATE he was again examined by the traumatologist , with the same diagnosis , and by the neurologist who diagnosed him with a head injury and possible concussion .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the prosecutor ’s office to send him a copy of the forensic report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office issued another decision refusing to institute criminal proceedings into the alleged ill - treatment . It relied on the statements of the ORG staff and the cellmate denying that force had been applied to the applicant at the ORG .
CARDINAL . As he had received no reply to his letter of DATE , on DATE the applicant reiterated his request for a copy of the forensic report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s cellmate at the ORG in GPE , S. , wrote to the prosecutor ’s office of ORG confirming the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment . He contended that on DATE at TIME the applicant was placed in cell no . CARDINAL ; that he was bleeding and bruised , his clothes were torn and bloodstained and he was unable to move around the cell without help . He had confirmed that the applicant had apparently been tortured by the special squadron police during his transfer from ORG and stated that no medical help was provided to the applicant at the detention facility .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the same assistant prosecutor requested a further report on the applicant . On DATE an expert drew up the report . The applicant himself was not present , and the expert studied only a CARDINAL - page extract of the applicant ’s medical file issued on DATE . He concluded that it contained insufficient information and that , in the absence of the original medical documents , he could not establish whether the applicant had suffered any injuries .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office refused again to institute criminal proceedings into the alleged ill - treatment , referring to the statements of ORG and to the fact that the expert had been unable to establish any injuries in the report of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following complaints by the applicant , ORG of the LOC quashed the decision of DATE and ordered the inquiry to be continued . She gave detailed instructions to the prosecutor ’s office of ORG to carry out a number of steps to verify the allegations , including questioning of the medical personnel who examined the applicant on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE , obtaining the original medical records , establishing the identity of the staff members who had made or required the extracts of the medical files , and questioning ORG staff and cellmates about the applicant ’s injuries .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of ORG took a new decision refusing to institute criminal proceedings into the alleged ill - treatment . The decision essentially reiterated the preceding ones and concluded that the applicant ’s allegations were unsubstantiated . The applicant complained to the prosecutor ’s office about the refusal to hold an investigation and requested access to the file .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG wrote to the applicant to apologise for the false statement he had made to the office of the prosecutor conducting the ill - treatment inquiry . He explained that although he had remembered the “ monstrous ” beatings the applicant was subjected to during the transfer , he felt that telling about it would put him at risk .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing in the applicant ’s criminal case and gave judgment . The applicant was found guilty of burglary and aggravated murder and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . During the trial the applicant complained of ill - treatment , and several witnesses testified that he been injured . The court did not examine the issue further .

CARDINAL . Following requests by the applicant , on DATE and CARDINAL DATE the prosecutor ’s office refused to grant him access to the inquiry file . The applicant challenged the refusal before ORG . On DATE the court granted the applicant ’s claim and ordered the prosecutor ’s office to give the applicant access to the case file . CARDINAL pages of copies of the documents were sent to the applicant on DATE . They did not include the expert report of DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unidentified date the applicant challenged the decision of CARDINAL DATE refusing the investigation of his ill - treatment before ORG . Among other arguments he referred to the forensic examination that he underwent on DATE and requested that the results be included in the case file . On DATE the court returned his complaint , stating that it could not examine the matter while a similar complaint was under examination by the prosecutor ’s office . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG replied to the applicant that ORG had never received the applicant ’s complaint challenging the decision of DATE , and that in any event the latter was not amenable to judicial review because the applicant ’s arguments had already been examined in substance in the criminal proceedings against the applicant which had ended in his conviction .

CARDINAL . Despite the above letter , the applicant ’s complaint was subsequently accepted for examination by ORG , and the applicant requested to attend the hearing . He also requested that his lawyer be informed about the date of the court hearing . The applicant claims that neither he nor his lawyer were notified of when the hearing was scheduled .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court examined the complaint . Neither the applicant nor his counsel were present , but the public prosecutor took part in the hearing . The court upheld the decision of DATE dispensing with a criminal investigation . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG examined the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the decision of DATE , finding the allegations of ill - treatment unsubstantiated and the prosecutor ’s decision well - founded . It appears that neither the applicant nor his lawyer were present at the hearing , while the prosecutor was .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave notice of this application to the respondent Government .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor of the Yaroslavl Region submitted a request to ORG to have the decisions of DATE and DATE quashed in supervisory - review proceedings . The ground for the request was the absence of the applicant from the proceedings at both levels of jurisdiction . On DATE that request was granted , and the applicant ’s complaint was remitted for fresh examination by the district court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the ORG issued a report on the internal inquiry relating to the applicant ’s complaints of ill - treatment . Having referred to the previous decisions by the prosecutor ’s office and the courts , it stated that the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment were unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG scheduled a hearing on DATE and ordered that the applicant be brought from the correctional facility to take part in the proceedings . The applicant requested CARDINAL times that the hearing be postponed . The requests were granted , the first time to allow him time for preparation , the second time following the replacement of his counsel and the third time to allow him more time to read the file . The hearing was postponed until DATE , then until DATE , and finally until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court began examining the applicant ’s claim . The applicant was present at the hearing and made oral submissions . The hearing continued until DATE , when the court held a judgment dismissing the claims . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted the applicant ’s appeal , reversed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for fresh examination by the district court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district court examined the applicant ’s claims in fresh proceedings and granted them in full . It noted that the prosecutor ’s office had not taken all the measures necessary to enable a reasoned , lawful and well - grounded decision , in particular that it had failed to take into account the results of the forensic examination that took place on DATE . It therefore declared the refusal to investigate the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment in criminal proceedings unlawful and ordered the prosecutor ’s office to rectify the omissions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . The parties did not inform the ORG what follow - up measures had been taken by the prosecutor ’s office , if any .
